name: Variable Chaining & Multi-Step Composition
description: Tests the core power of Sys2DSL: composing complex reasoning through variable references ($varName). This is the fundamental mechanism for building complex queries from simpler components. Each query tests progressively more complex variable chaining patterns.

theory.natural_language: Student enrollment system: Alice is enrolled in Math101 and Physics201. Bob is enrolled in Math101 and Chemistry101. Math101 is a prerequisite for Math201. Physics201 is a prerequisite for Physics301. Chemistry101 is a prerequisite for Chemistry201. Math201 is an advanced course. Physics301 is an advanced course. Chemistry201 is an advanced course. To take an advanced course, students must complete its prerequisites. Product inventory: Warehouse_A has ProductX quantity 50. Warehouse_B has ProductX quantity 30. Warehouse_C has ProductY quantity 100. ProductX has minimum_stock 40. ProductY has minimum_stock 80. A warehouse needs restocking if quantity is below minimum_stock. Access control: Employee_1 has role Manager. Employee_2 has role Engineer. Managers can access finance_data. Managers can access hr_data. Engineers can access tech_data. Engineers can access code_repo. Sensitive data requires manager approval. Medical diagnosis: Patient_A has symptom fever. Patient_A has symptom cough. Patient_A has symptom fatigue. Flu causes fever. Flu causes cough. Flu causes fatigue. Cold causes cough. Cold causes mild_fever. Pneumonia causes fever. Pneumonia causes cough. Pneumonia causes difficulty_breathing. If a condition causes ALL symptoms a patient has, it's a likely diagnosis.

queries.natural_language: Find all courses Alice is enrolled in and check if the list is non-empty.

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Alice has enrollments. She is enrolled in Math101 and Physics201.
expected_answer.explanation: Basic chaining: FACTS_MATCHING result passed to NONEMPTY via $courses

queries.natural_language: Does Bob have at least one enrollment?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Bob has enrollments - he is enrolled in Math101 and Chemistry101.
expected_answer.explanation: Chaining FACTS_MATCHING to NONEMPTY: Bob has 2 enrollments so TRUE

queries.natural_language: Is Alice enrolled in both Math101 and Physics201?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Alice is enrolled in both Math101 and Physics201.
expected_answer.explanation: Multi-ASK composition: two ASK results combined with BOOL_AND

queries.natural_language: Can Alice take Physics301 (which requires Physics201)?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Alice can take Physics301 because she has completed Physics201 which is its prerequisite.
expected_answer.explanation: Prerequisite chain: find prereq, check if student has it

queries.natural_language: Can Bob take Math201 (which requires Math101)?
queries.expected_dsl:
@prereqMath FACTS_WITH_OBJECT Math201
@bobHasMath ASK Bob ENROLLED_IN Math101

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Bob can take Math201 because he has completed Math101.
expected_answer.explanation: Same pattern as q4 but for Bob and Math

queries.natural_language: Does Employee_1 (a Manager) have access to both finance_data and hr_data?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Employee_1 is a Manager and Managers can access both finance_data and hr_data.
expected_answer.explanation: Role lookup + permission check via BOOL_AND composition

queries.expected_dsl:
@role2 FACTS_MATCHING Employee_2 HAS_ROLE
@q7 ASK Engineer CAN_ACCESS finance_data

expected_answer.natural_language: No, Employee_2 is an Engineer and Engineers cannot access finance_data (only tech_data and code_repo).
expected_answer.explanation: Role check shows Engineer, which has no finance_data access (returns UNKNOWN since no explicit fact)

queries.natural_language: Find all symptoms Patient_A has and check if flu could explain them all.

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Flu causes all three symptoms that Patient_A has (fever, cough, fatigue), making it a likely diagnosis.
expected_answer.explanation: Complex multi-step: gather symptoms, check each against flu, AND all results

queries.natural_language: Does Cold explain all of Patient_A's symptoms?

expected_answer.natural_language: No, Cold only causes cough and mild_fever, not fever and fatigue. Cold doesn't explain all symptoms.
expected_answer.explanation: Cold doesn't cause fever (only mild_fever) or fatigue, so BOOL_AND chain fails

queries.natural_language: Combine Alice's and Bob's course lists - do they have any combined enrollments?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, combined Alice and Bob have enrollments (Alice: Math101, Physics201; Bob: Math101, Chemistry101).
expected_answer.explanation: Aggregation pattern: FACTS_MATCHING × 2 → MERGE_LISTS → NONEMPTY = TRUE

queries.natural_language: In a hypothetical scenario where Alice drops Math101, does she still have any enrollments?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, even if Alice drops Math101, she still has Physics201.
expected_answer.explanation: Theory layer test: PUSH → RETRACT → check → POP. Variable holds result across operations.

queries.natural_language: After hypothetically removing Math101, does Alice still have enrollments?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Alice still has Physics201 enrollment even after removing Math101.
expected_answer.explanation: Theory layer with unique variable names: push2, retract2, pop2
